notice.ch: 大三、大四同學欲選修，須先與教師洽談領取密碼卡。

remark.ch: 大三、大四同學欲選修，須先與教師洽談領取密碼卡。

goal.ch: 本課程以核心關鍵字為起點，引領學生瞭解當代美學理論發展的重要梗概。個別的理論關鍵字雖然僅能拉出一至兩條縱深的思考軸線，然而透過關鍵字群的挑選與匯聚，卻可配置出獨特的思想共振平面，進而為我們的討論提供相對清晰的迴路、視角、範圍和邊界。本課程著重在概念與概念之間所能形成的布置（dispositif）型態與叢集（constellation）關係，使美學的討論跳脫「美的歷史」或「自然美vs.藝術美」的既有框架。另一方面，藉助當代文學、音樂和藝術中的基進案例，我們也將深究這些美學思潮在知識建構方式上的具體轉變。
goal.en: This course takes some keywords as a starting point to lead students to an important overview of the development of contemporary aesthetic theory. While individual keywords can only draw out one or two contexts, the convergence of them can configure a unique “plane of thinking”, which in turn provides a relatively clear circuit, perspective, scope, and boundary for our discussion. This course focuses on the dispositif and constellation that can be formed between concepts, allowing the discussion of aesthetics to break away from the established framework of “history of beauty” or “natural beauty vs. artistic beauty”. With the help of contemporary examples from literature, music, and the arts, we will also explore the specific changes in the way these aesthetic trends construct knowledge.

outline.ch:
本課程規劃四大主題方向，藉以收攏與之相關的理論關鍵字，以及它們各自可觸及的藝術創作類型。入選的當代理論文本皆側重它們與具體的藝術實踐的解析效力，或者對藝術創作所帶來的深刻啟發。從最基本的美感經驗論和藝術哲學的當代反省出發，帶領修課同學逐步觸及素描、繪畫、攝影、電影、數位影像、空間裝置等創作領域所隱含的美學課題。
每週詳細主題的規劃如下：
主題一：重返美感經驗論
第一週（09/09）：「課程簡介：何謂美感經驗？」
關鍵字：無我經驗（Selfless Experience）
指定閱讀：Jacques Maquet, The Aesthetic Experience: Anthropologist Looks at the Visual Arts (New Haven, CT: Yale University Press, 1988), Chapter 8, 14.
賈課‧瑪奎，《美感經驗：一位人類學者眼中的視覺藝術》，第八、十四章。
第二週（09/16）：「回到康德：無關乎利害性的殘餘」
關鍵字：無關乎利害性（Disinterestedness）
指定閱讀：Norman Kreitman, “The Varieties of Aesthetic Disinterestedness,” from Contemporary Aesthetics vol. 4.
第三週（09/23）：「美感經驗的終結」
關鍵字：美感經驗（Aesthetic Experience）
指定閱讀：Richard Shusterman, “The End of Aesthetic Experience,” Journal of Aesthetics and Art Criticism 55, no. 1 (1997): 29–42.
Arnold Berleant, “Beyond Disinterestedness,” The British Journal of Aesthetics 34, no. 3 (1994): 242–54.
第四週（09/30）：「美的廢止，或藝術哲學的重建」
關鍵字：藝術哲學（The Philosophy of Art）
指定閱讀：Arthur C. Danto, The Abuse of Beauty: The Paul Carus Lectures 21 (Chicago, IL: Open Court Publishing, 2003), Chapter 1, 2.
主題二：造形與描繪的美學
第五週（10/07）：「素描與書寫的邏輯」
關鍵字：書寫（Writing）
指定閱讀：Tim Ingold, Lines: A Brief History (London, England: Routledge, 2016), Chapter 5.
第六週（10/14）：「描繪及其未知盲域」
關鍵字：素描/描繪（Drawing）
指定閱讀：Jacques Derrida, Memoirs of the Blind: The Self-Portrait and Other Ruins, trans. Pascale-Anne Brault and Michael Naas (Chicago, IL: University of Chicago Press, 1993), PP. 1-44
第七週（10/21）：「巴洛克機器與永動世界」
關鍵字：巴洛克（Baroque）
指定閱讀：Gilles Deleuze, The Fold: Leibniz and the Baroque, trans. Tom Conley (Continuum International Publishing Group, 2000), Chapter 1, 3
第八週（10/28）：「神性機器的完美世界」
關鍵字：單子（Monad）
指定閱讀：W. G. Leibnitz, “The Monadology,” Robert Latta (Trans.), from Marxists Internet Archive, Retrieved from: https://www.marxists.org/reference/subject/philosophy/works/ge/leibniz.htm
（附中譯本）
主題三：影像與復返的美學
第九週（11/04）：「影像、身體及觸覺性」
關鍵字：觸覺性（Tactilty）
指定閱讀：Jennifer M. Barker, The Tactile Eye: Touch and the Cinematic Experience (Berkeley, CA: University of California Press, 2009), Introduction.
第十週（11/11）：「緩慢時間與錄像的當刻經驗」
關鍵字：交錯時間（Interlacing Time）
指定閱讀：Lutz Koepnick, On Slowness: Toward an Aesthetic of the Contemporary (New York, NY: Columbia University Press, 2014), Chapter 6.
第十一週（11/18）：「大寫影像與影像的無盡增生」
關鍵字：弱影像（Poor image）
指定閱讀：Hito Steyerl, “In Defense of the Poor Image,” from e-flux, Retrieved from: https://www.e-flux.com/journal/10/61362/in-defense-of-the-poor-image/
Boris Groys, “From Image to Image File—and Back” from Art Power (London, England: MIT Press, 2013), pp. 83-91.
第十二週（11/25）：「重複影像與強度的不相稱性」
關鍵字：永恆回歸（Eternal return）
指定閱讀：Gilles Deleuze, Difference and Repetition, trans. Paul Patton (New York, NY: Columbia University Press, 1995), Chapter 1 “Difference in itself,” Chapter 5 “Asymmetrical Synthesis of the Sensible.”
主題四：空間與布置的美學
第十三週（12/02）：「空間治理及其潛在規訓」
關鍵字：治理性（Governmentality）
指定閱讀：Brian O’Doherty, Inside the White Cube: The Ideology of the Gallery Space, Expanded Edition (Berkeley, CA: University of California Press, 2000), Part I “Notes on the Gallery Space.”
第十四週（12/09）：「強度聚合與不可能的鄰近關係」
關鍵字：裝置（Installation）
指定閱讀：Boris Groys, “Politics of Installation,” from e-flux, Retrieved from: https://www.e-flux.com/journal/02/68504/politics-of-installation/
Boris Groys, “On the New,” from Art Power (London, England: MIT Press, 2013), pp. 23-42.
第十五週（12/16）：「主體性的布置與切割」
關鍵字：布置（Dispositif）
指定閱讀：Giorgio Agamben, What Is an Apparatus? : And Other Essays. Stanford, Calif.: Stanford University Press, 2009), pp. 1-24.
Agamben, What Is Apparatus and Other Essays.
延伸閱讀：Alain Brossat，〈傅科的「布置」觀念〉，《文化研究》第六期（增刊）（2008年夏季）：230-240
第十六週（12/23）：「神聖空間與褻瀆之力」
關鍵字：渾濁化（Profanation）
指定閱讀：Giorgio Agamben, “In Praise of Profanation,” Profanations, trans. Jeff Fort (Zone Books, 2020), pp. 73-92.
第十七週（12/30）：課堂報告與綜合討論 I
第十八週（01/06）：課堂報告與綜合討論 II
outline.en:
The course is organized in four major subjects, in order to bring together the theoretical keywords that are relevant to them, and the types of artistic practices they can address. The selected contemporary texts all emphasize their effectiveness in analyzing specific artistic practices or their profound inspiration for artists. Starting from the basic theory of aesthetic experience and the contemporary reflection of art philosophy, the course leads students to gradually explore the aesthetic issues implicit in the fields of drawing, painting, photography, film, digital image, and spatial installation.
The Schedule is as follow:
Week 1:
Jacques Maquet, The Aesthetic Experience: Anthropologist Looks at the Visual Arts (New Haven, CT: Yale University Press, 1988), Chapter 8, 14.
Week 2:
Norman Kreitman, “The Varieties of Aesthetic Disinterestedness,” from Contemporary Aesthetics vol. 4. Retrieved from: http://hdl.handle.net/2027/spo.7523862.0004.018
Week 3:
Richard Shusterman, “The End of Aesthetic Experience,” Journal of Aesthetics and Art Criticism 55, no. 1 (1997): 29–42.
Arnold Berleant, “Beyond Disinterestedness,” The British Journal of Aesthetics 34, no. 3 (1994): 242–54.
Week 4:
Arthur C. Danto, The Abuse of Beauty: The Paul Carus Lectures 21 (Chicago, IL: Open Court Publishing, 2003), Chapter 1, 2.
Week 5:
Tim Ingold, Lines: A Brief History (London, England: Routledge, 2016), Chapter 5.
Week 6:
Jacques Derrida, Memoirs of the Blind: The Self-Portrait and Other Ruins, trans. Pascale-Anne Brault and Michael Naas (Chicago, IL: University of Chicago Press, 1993), PP. 1-44.
Week 7:
Gilles Deleuze, The Fold: Leibniz and the Baroque, trans. Tom Conley (Continuum International Publishing Group, 2000), Chapter 1, 3
Week 8:
W. G. Leibnitz, “The Monadology,” Robert Latta (Trans.), from Marxists Internet Archive, Retrieved from: https://www.marxists.org/reference/subject/philosophy/works/ge/leibniz.htm
Week 9:
Jennifer M. Barker, The Tactile Eye: Touch and the Cinematic Experience (Berkeley, CA: University of California Press, 2009), Introduction.
Week 10:
Lutz Koepnick, On Slowness: Toward an Aesthetic of the Contemporary (New York, NY: Columbia University Press, 2014), Chapter 6.
Week 11:
Hito Steyerl, “In Defense of the Poor Image,” from e-flux, Retrieved from: https://www.e-flux.com/journal/10/61362/in-defense-of-the-poor-image/
Boris Groys, “From Image to Image File—and Back” from Art Power (London, England: MIT Press, 2013), pp. 83-91.
Week 12:
Gilles Deleuze, Difference and Repetition, trans. Paul Patton (New York, NY: Columbia University Press, 1995), Chapter 1 “Difference in itself,” Chapter 5 “Asymmetrical Synthesis of the Sensible.”
Week 13:
Brian O’Doherty, Inside the White Cube: The Ideology of the Gallery Space, Expanded Edition (Berkeley, CA: University of California Press, 2000), Part I “Notes on the Gallery Space.”
Week 14:
Boris Groys, “Politics of Installation,” from e-flux, Retrieved from: https://www.e-flux.com/journal/02/68504/politics-of-installation/
Boris Groys, “On the New,” from Art Power (London, England: MIT Press, 2013), pp. 23-42.
Week 15:
Giorgio Agamben, What Is an Apparatus? : And Other Essays. Stanford, Calif.: Stanford University Press, 2009), pp. 1-24.
Week 16:
Giorgio Agamben, “In Praise of Profanation,” Profanations, trans. Jeff Fort (Zone Books, 2020), pp. 73-92.
Week 17: Final Presenatation I
Week 18: Final Presenatation II

textbook.ch:
中文書目：

Brossat, Alan（2008）。〈傅科的「布置」觀念〉，《文化研究》第六期：230-240。
楊凱麟（2014）。〈起源與重複：德勒茲哲學的差異問題性〉，《政大哲學學報》第31期：107-140。

英文書目：

Agamben, Giorgio (2007). Profanation, Jeff Fort (Trans.) New York: Zone Books.
__________ (2009). “What Is Apparatus?” and Other Essays, David Kishik ＆ Stefan Pedatella (Trans.) Stanford: Stanford University Press.
Barker, Jennifer M. The Tactile Eye: Touch and the Cinematic Experience. Berkeley, CA: University of California Press, 2009.
Berleant, Arnold. “Beyond Disinterestedness.” The British Journal of Aesthetics 34, no. 3 (1994): 242–54.
Danto, Arthur C. The Abuse of Beauty: The Paul Carus Lectures 21. Chicago, IL: Open Court Publishing, 2003.
Deleuze, Gilles (1988). “What is a dispositif?” in Timothy J. Armstrong (Ed.) Michel Foucault Philosopher, (pp. 159- 168), New York: Routledge.
__________ (1988). Logic of Sense, Constantin Boundas (Ed.), Mark Lester and Charles Stivale (Trans.) New York: Columbia University Press.
__________ (1995). Difference and Repetition. Paul Patton (Trans.). New York, NY: Columbia University Press.
__________ (2000). The Fold: Leibniz and the Baroque. Tom Conley(Trans.) Continuum International Publishing Group.
Derrida, Jacques. Memoirs of the Blind: The Self-Portrait and Other Ruins. Translated by Pascale-Anne Brault and Michael Naas. Chicago, IL: University of Chicago Press, 1993.
Foucault, Michel and Maurice Blanchot (1989). Michel Foucault / Maurice Blanchot, Brian Massumi and Jeffrey Mehlman (Trans.) New York: Zone Books.
Groys, Boris. Art Power. London, England: MIT Press, 2013.
Ingold, Tim. Lines: A Brief History. London, England: Routledge, 2016.
Koepnick, Lutz. On Slowness: Toward an Aesthetic of the Contemporary. New York, NY: Columbia University Press, 2014.
Massumi, B. (2002). Parables for the Virtual: Movement, Affect, Sensation. Durham, NC: Duke University Press Books.
Maquet, Jacques Jerome Pierre. The Aesthetic Experience: Anthropologist Looks at the Visual Arts. New Haven, CT: Yale University Press, 1988.
Nancy, Jean-Luc (2008). Corpus, Richard A. Rand (Trans.) New York: Fordham University Press.
O’Doherty, Brian. Inside the White Cube: The Ideology of the Gallery Space, Expanded Edition. Berkeley, CA: University of California Press, 2000.
Shusterman, Richard. “The End of Aesthetic Experience.” Journal of Aesthetics and Art Criticism 55, no. 1 (1997): 29–42.
Rosi Braidotti, “Nomadic Ethics,” in Deleuze Studies. 7, 3: 342-359.

網頁資料：

Groys, Boris (2009) “Politics of Installation,” from e-flux, Retrieved from: https://www.e-flux.com/journal/02/68504/politics-of-installation/
Accessed September 1, 2024.
Leibnitz, G. W. (1898). “The Monadology,” Robert Latta (Trans.), from Marxists Internet Archive, Retrieved from: https://www.marxists.org/reference/subject/philosophy/works/ge/leibniz.htm Accessed September 1, 2024.
Kreitman, Norman. (2006) “The Varieties of Aesthetic Disinterestedness,” from Contemporary Aesthetics vol. 4, Retrieved from: http://hdl.handle.net/2027/spo.7523862.0004.018
Accessed September 1, 2024.
Steyerl, Hito. (2009). “In Defense of the Poor Image,” from e-flux Journal Issue #10, Retrieved from: https://www.e-flux.com/journal/10/61362/in-defense-of-the-poor-image/
Accessed September 1, 2024.

gradMethod.ch: 課程討論及參與度40％，期末報告60％
gradMethod.en: 40％ for participation and discussion, and 60％ for the final essay.
